name: llm_search
description: Get web search results with the serp and google search api, and support get detail crawl result.

query.description: The search query. You can use anything that you would use in a regular Google search. e.g. inurl:, site:, intitle:. We also support advanced search query parameters such as as_dt and as_eq.
query.title: Query

location.description: Parameter defines from where you want the search to originate. If several locations match the location requested, we'll pick the most popular one. It is recommended to specify location at the city level in order to simulate a real user's search.
location.title: Location

num.description: Parameter defines the maximum number of results to return. (e.g., 5 (default) returns 5 results, 10 return 10 results). The use of num may introduce latency, and/or prevent the inclusion of specialized result types. It is better to omit this parameter unless it is strictly necessary to increase the number of results per page.
num.title: Num

start.description: Parameter defines the result offset. It skips the given number of results. It's used for pagination. (e.g., 0 (default) is the first page of results, num * 1 is the 2nd page of results, num * 2 is the 3rd page of results, etc.).
start.title: Start

crawl.description: Parameter defines whether to crawl the search result page contents. If false (default), only the title, URL, and description will be returned like a search engine result page. If true, then the pages' contents will also be returned in markdown format. Enabling this option will add latency, and not all pages may be crawled successfully due to a timeout.
crawl.title: Crawl

device.description: Parameter defines the device to use to get the results. It can be set to desktop (default) to use a regular browser, tablet to use a tablet browser (currently using iPads), or mobile to use a mobile browser (currently using iPhones).
device.title: Device

name: exa_search
description: search with exa search tool without crawl

query.description: The search query. You can use anything that you would use in a regular Exa search.
query.title: Query

num_results.description: Parameter defines the maximum number of results to return. (e.g., 10 (default) returns 10 results).
num_results.title: Num Results

device.description: Parameter defines the device to use to get the results. It can be set to desktop (default) to use a regular browser, tablet to use a tablet browser (currently using iPads), or mobile to use a mobile browser (currently using iPhones).
device.title: Device
